required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tomographic Assessment on the Influence of the Use of a Collagen Membrane to Protect the Antrostomy After Maxillary Sinus Floor Augmentation.
clinical_study.official_title: Cone Beam Computed Tomography Assessment on the Influence a Collagen Membrane Placed on the Antrostomy After Maxillary Sinus Floor Augmentation. A Randomized Clinical Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: the aim of the present study was to evaluate the dimensional variation and healing of the antrostomy left unprotected or protected with a collagen membrane

detailed_description.textblock:
The Schneiderian mucosa will be elevated and the created space will be filled with a natural bovine bone grafting material (Cerabone® 1-2 mm, Botiss Biomaterials GmbH). In ten patients randomly selected (control sties), a native collagen membrane made of porcine dermis (Collprotect®, Botiss Biomaterials GmbH) will be placed on the antrostomy. In ten patients of the test group, the antrostomy will be left without the membrane. The flaps will be sutured and anti-inflammatory drugs and antibiotics will be administrated to the patients. The sutures will be removed after 7 days.
CBCTs will be taken for all patients before surgery (T0), after 1 week from sinus floor augmentation (T1) and after 9 months of healing (T2) and evaluation of dimensional variations over time of soft and hard tissues will be performed.

study_design_info.masking_description: the surgeon will be blinded until the maxillary sinus augmentation is filled with the biomaterial.

primary_outcome.measure: Changing in height of the elevated zone.
primary_outcome.time_frame: The CBCTs will be taken before surgery (T0) and 1-week (T1) and 9 months (T2) after surgery
primary_outcome.description: will be assessed in the medial, middle and lateral regions of the elevated zone using the cone beam computerized tomographies

secondary_outcome.measure: Changing in area of the elevated zone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The CBCTs will be taken before surgery (T0) and 1-week (T1) and 9 months (T2) after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The area will be delineated by the sinus bone walls and the sinus mucosa. The changes will be evaluated on the cone beam computerized tomographies (CBCTs) taken in various periods.

arm_group.description: The space obtained underneath the sinus mucosa will be filled with the xenograft without protecting the antrostomy with a collagen membrane in the test sites.
The space obtained underneath the sinus mucosa will be filled with the xenograft and a resorbable collagen membrane will be placed to cover the antrostomy only at the randomly selected control sites.

intervention.description: Surgical technique for increasing the vertical bone height of the posterior maxilla an antrostomy of about 5 mm in height and 10 mm long will be prepared using a diamond insert mounted on a sonic-air surgical instrument. The Schneiderian membrane will be elevated and clinical measurements will be performed using an UNC 15 probe. The space obtained underneath the sinus mucosa will be filled with the xenograft and a resorbable collagen membrane will be placed to cover the antrostomy only at the randomly selected control sites.
intervention.other_name: maxillary sinus lift, maxillary sinus elevation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Presence of an edentulous atrophic zone in the posterior segment of the maxilla
- Height of the sinus floor ≤4 mm.
- Desiring a prosthetic restoration of the zone using a fix prosthesis supported by implants
- ≥ 21 years of age
- Good general health
- No contraindication for oral surgical procedures
- Not being pregnant.
Exclusion Criteria:The patients will be excluded if they present:
- A systemic disordered.
- Had a chemotherapic or radiotherapeutic treatment.
- Are smokers >10 cigarettes per day
- Have an acute or a chronic sinusitis.
- Had a previous bone augmentation procedures in the zone of interest.
